intro: Hieracium chlarodes, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with white ray florets, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Hieracium chlarodes is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread through vegetative means.
